file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 27-31-08-04 - SPRING TAB - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL SPRING TAB - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the spring tabs. B. These procedures are applicable to the LH and RH spring tabs. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 27-31-08-000-801-A SPRING TAB - REMOVAL ALL 27-31-08-400-801-A SPRING TAB - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 27-31-08 Page 1 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 27-31-08-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. SPRING TAB - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the spring tab. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION HORIZONTAL-STABILIZER ATTACHMENT FAIRING - AMM TASK 55-14-00-000-801-A/400 REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 335 Elevator 336 Elevator D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Elevator 1 Helps the other technician Elevator I. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A WARNING: MAKE SURE THAT THE RUDDER CANNOT BE OPERATED ACCIDENTALLY. AN ACCIDENTAL OPERATION OF THE RUDDER CAN CAUSE INJURY TO PERSONS. (1) Remove the fairings (28) ( AMM TASK 55-14-00-000-801-A/400). Refer to DET. F. (2) Remove the fairings (29) ( AMM TASK 55-14-00-000-801-A/400). Refer to DET. G. (3) Remove the cotter pin (18) and discard it. Refer to DET. C. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 27-31-08 Page 2 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (4) Remove the nut (19), two washers (6), two bushings (5), and bolt (7) to disconnect the ends of the rods (17) from the hinge (4) at the spring tab (1). Refer to DET. C. (5) Remove the cotter pin (23) and discard it. Refer to DET. D. (6) Remove the nut (24), two washers (25), two bushings (22), and bolt (27) to disconnect the hinges (26) of the spring tab (1) from the supports (21) at the elevator structure. Refer to DET. D. (7) Remove the cotter pin (34) and discard it. Refer to DET. H. (8) Remove the nut (35), two washers (36), two bushings (37), and bolt (39) to disconnect the hinges (38) of the spring tab (1) from the supports (30) at the elevator structure. Refer to DET. H. WARNING: USE EYE PROTECTION WHEN YOU REMOVE OR INSTALL LOCKWIRE OR SAFETY CABLE. IF YOU DO NOT USE EYE PROTECTION, CUT PIECES OF WIRE CAN HIT YOUR EYES AND CAUSE INJURY. CAUTION: DO NOT LET PIECES OF DISCARDED LOCK WIRE STAY IN THE AIRCRAFT OR IN THE WORK AREA. IF NECESSARY, USE A VACUUM CLEANER TO REMOVE THEM. (9) Remove and discard the lockwire (33). Refer to DET. H. (10) Remove one of bolts (32) and washer (31) from the support (30) at the elevator structure to disconnect the end of the bonding strap (3). Refer to DET. H. (11) Remove the cotter pin (16) and discard it. Refer to DET. C. (12) Remove the nut (15), two washers (9), bushing (10), and bolt (8) to disconnect the hinge (4) of the spring tab (1) from the support (11) at the elevator structure. Refer to DET. C. WARNING: USE EYE PROTECTION WHEN YOU REMOVE OR INSTALL LOCKWIRE OR SAFETY CABLE. IF YOU DO NOT USE EYE PROTECTION, CUT PIECES OF WIRE CAN HIT YOUR EYES AND CAUSE INJURY. CAUTION: DO NOT LET PIECES OF DISCARDED LOCK WIRE STAY IN THE AIRCRAFT OR IN THE WORK AREA. IF NECESSARY, USE A VACUUM CLEANER TO REMOVE THEM. (13) Remove and discard the lockwire (14). Refer to DET. C. (14) Remove one of bolts (13) and washer (12) from the support (11) at the elevator structure to disconnect the end of the bonding strap (2). Refer to DET. C. (15) Remove the spring tab (1). (16) If necessary, remove the screw (20), three washers, and nut to disconnect the ends of the bonding straps (2) and (3) from the spring tab (1). Refer to DET. E. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 27-31-08 Page 3 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Spring Tab - Removal/Installation Figure 401 G F 1. SPRING A TAB ZONE C 336 A D ZONE B E 335 H DET. A 3. BONDING (TYPICAL) STRAP 20. SCREW E 2. BONDING STRAP WASHER (3) DET. B NUT 6. WASHER (2) 3 4. HINGE 3 7. BOLT (SPRING TAB 5. BUSHING (2) STRUCTURE) 3 1 8. BOLT 19. NUT 4 18. COTTER PIN 9. WASHER (2) BONDING STRAP 3 10. BUSHING (REF.) DET. E (TYPICAL) 17. ROD (2) 11. SUPPORT (ELEVATOR SPRING TAB STRUCTURE) (REF.) 15. NUT 2. BONDING STRAP 16. COTTER PIN 1 4 12. WASHER DET. C 3 5 13. BOLT 14. LOCKWIRE 21. SUPPORT 28. FAIRING DET. F 3 (ELEVATOR 23. COTTER PIN STRUCTURE) 22. BUSHING (2) 2 29. FAIRING 24. NUT 3 25. WASHER (2) 27. BOLT 26. HINGE (SPRING TAB STRUCTURE) DET. D 4 3. BONDING STRAP SPRING TAB 31. WASHER (REF.) 3 5 32. BOLT 30. SUPPORT DET. G (ELEVATOR 34. COTTER PIN STRUCTURE) 33. LOCKWIRE 1 TORQUE: 5.6 - 6.8 N.m (50 - 60 lb.in) PLUS LOCKING TORQUE. 2 35. NUT 2 TORQUE: 1.7 - 2.3 N.m (15 - 20 lb.in) PLUS LOCKING TORQUE. 36. WASHER (2) 3 3 37. BUSHING (2) CORROSION-INHIBITING COMPOUND 38. HINGE 4 ELECTRICAL BONDING (METHOD 7). 3 (SPRING TAB 39. BOLT STRUCTURE) 5 DET. H TORQUE: 1.4 - 1.7 N.m (12 - 15 lb.in) EM145AMM270238E.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 27-31-08 Page 4 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 27-31-08-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. SPRING TAB - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the spring tab. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION ELECTRICAL BONDING TEST - STANDARD PROCE- AMM TASK 20-13-21-700-801-A/200 DURES TYPES OF ELECTRICAL BONDING AND SURFACE AMM TASK 20-13-21-910-801-A/200 PREPARATION - STANDARD PROCEDURES ELECTRICAL BONDING PROTECTION - STANDARD AMM TASK 20-13-21-910-802-A/200 PROCEDURES ELEVATOR PRIMARY MECHANICAL CONTROL AMM TASK 27-31-00-700-801-A/500 BACKLASH - FUNCTIONAL CHECK AMM TASK 27-31-04-700-801-A/500 SPRING AND SERVO TABS - OPERATIONAL CHECK AMM TASK 27-31-08-700-801-A/500 SPRING TAB - ADJUSTMENT AMM TASK 51-60-00-700-801-A/500 ELEVATOR STATIC BALANCING AMM TASK 51-60-01-700-801-A/500 - HORIZONTAL-STABILIZER ATTACHMENT FAIRING - AMM TASK 55-14-00-400-801-A/400 INSTALLATION IPC 55-22-00 TRIM TAB C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 335 Elevator 336 Elevator D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Torque Wrench To apply the torques Available E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MEP 09-060 Corrosion-Inhibiting Compound (CA-1000) AR MEP 09-075 Corrosion-Inhibiting Compound (COR-BAN 27L) AR EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 27-31-08 Page 5 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (Continued) SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MS20995C20 Lockwire AR G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) Cotter pin IPC 55-22-00 3 H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Elevator 1 Helps the other technician Elevator I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) ) If you replaced the spring tab by a different one, do the Spring Tab Static Balancing (AMM TASK 51-60-01-700-801-A/500). NOTE: If the same Spring Stab is installed and has not been repaired and or repainted, Static Balance is not required. (2) Do the bonding procedures, method 7 (AMM TASK 20-13-21-910-801-A/200), to install the bonding jumpers (2) and (3) Figure 401. WARNING: CA-1000 OR COR-BAN 27L CORROSION-INHIBITING COMPOUND IS TOXIC TO SKIN, EYES, AND RESPIRATORY TRACT. USE GOGGLES AND PROTECTIVE GLOVES. USE ONLY IN WELL VENTILATED AREAS. OBEY THE MANUFACTURER’S HEALTH AND SAFETY INSTRUCTIONS. (3) Apply CA-1000 or COR-BAN 27L as shown in (Figure 401). J. Installation Figure 401 SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Put the spring tab (1) on the elevator structure. (2) Install the bolt (27), two washers (25), two bushings (22), and nut (24) to connect the hinges (26) of the spring tab (1) to the supports (21) at the elevator structure. Refer to DET. D. (3) Install bolt (32), washer (31) and the end of the bonding strap (3) to the support (30) at the elevator structure. Refer to DET. H. WARNING: USE EYE PROTECTION WHEN YOU REMOVE OR INSTALL LOCKWIRE OR SAFETY CABLE. IF YOU DO NOT USE EYE PROTECTION, CUT PIECES OF WIRE CAN HIT YOUR EYES AND CAUSE INJURY. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 27-31-08 Page 6 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (4) Torque the bolt (32) and safety it with the other bolts of the support (30) at the elevator structure with lockwire (33). Refer to DET. H. (5) Install the bolt (39), two washers (36), two bushings (37), and nut (35) to connect the hinges (38) of the spring tab (1) to the supports (30) at the elevator structure. Refer to DET. H. (6) Install bolt (13), washer (12) and the end of the bonding strap (2) to the support (11) at the elevator structure. Refer to DET. C. WARNING: USE EYE PROTECTION WHEN YOU REMOVE OR INSTALL LOCKWIRE OR SAFETY CABLE. IF YOU DO NOT USE EYE PROTECTION, CUT PIECES OF WIRE CAN HIT YOUR EYES AND CAUSE INJURY. (7) Torque the bolt (13) and safety it with the other bolts of the support (11) at the elevator structure with lockwire (14). Refer to DET. C. (8) Install the bolt (8), two washers (9), bushing (10), and nut (15) to connect the hinge (4) of the spring tab (1) to the support (11) at the elevator structure. Refer to DET. C. (9) Put the ends of the two rods (17) in the hinge (4) at the spring tab (1) and attach them with the bolt (7), two washers (6), two bushings (5), and nut (19). Refer to DET. C. (10) Make sure that the threads of the nut (24) and bolt (27) fully engage. The base of the nut (24) must not touch the surface. (11) Turn the nut (24) and measure the locking torque with a torque wrench. (12) Make sure that the locking torque value is 0.23 - 2.04 N.m (2 - 18 lb.in). NOTE: If you find a nut that is not in the correct range, you must replace it. (13) Add the locking torque value measured to the standard torque of 1.7 - 2.3 N.m (15 - 20 lb.in) to get the final torque. (14) Apply the final torque to the nut (24) with a torque wrench, as follows: (a) Tighten the nut (24) to the bolt (27) to remove clearance. (b) Torque the nut (24) with the minimum final torque value. Continue to torque as necessary to align the slot in the nut (24) with the cotter pin (23) hole in the bolt (27). NOTE: Be careful not to apply more than the maximum final torque value. (c) Safety the nut (24) to the bolt (27) with a new cotter pin (23). (15) Make sure that the threads of the nut (35) and bolt (39) fully engage. The base of the nut (35) must not touch the surface. (16) Turn the nut (35) and measure the locking torque with a torque wrench. (17) Make sure that the locking torque value is 0.23 - 2.04 N.m (2 - 18 lb.in). NOTE: If you find a nut that is not in the correct range, you must replace it. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 27-31-08 Page 7 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (18) Add the locking torque value measured to the standard torque of 1.7 - 2.3 N.m (15 - 20 lb.in) to get the final torque. (19) Apply the final torque to the nut (35) with a torque wrench, as follows: (a) Tighten the nut (35) to the bolt (39) to remove clearance. (b) Torque the nut (35) with the minimum final torque value. Continue to torque as necessary to align the slot in the nut (35) with the cotter pin (34) hole in the bolt (39). NOTE: Be careful not to apply more than the maximum final torque value. (c) Safety the nut (35) to the bolt (39) with a new cotter pin (34). (20) Make sure that the threads of the nut (15) and bolt (8) fully engage. The base of the nut (15) must not touch the surface. (21) Turn the nut (15) and measure the locking torque with a torque wrench. (22) Make sure that the locking torque value is 0.39 - 3.39 N.m (3.5 - 30 lb.in). NOTE: If you find a nut that is not in the correct range, you must replace it. (23) Add the locking torque value measured to the standard torque of 5.6 - 6.8 N.m (50 - 60 lb.in) to get the final torque. (24) Apply the final torque to the nut (15) with a torque wrench, as follows: (a) Tighten the nut (15) to the bolt (8) to remove clearance. (b) Torque the nut (15) with the minimum final torque value. Continue to torque as necessary to align the slot in the nut (15) with the cotter pin (16) hole in the bolt (8). NOTE: Be careful not to apply more than the maximum final torque value. (c) Safety the nut (15) to the bolt (8) with a new cotter pin (16). (25) Make sure that the threads of the nut (19) and bolt (7) fully engage. The base of the nut (19) must not touch the surface. (26) Turn the nut (19) and measure the locking torque with a torque wrench. (27) Make sure that the locking torque value is 0.39 - 3.39 N.m (3.5 - 30 lb.in). NOTE: If you find a nut that is not in the correct range, you must replace it. (28) Add the locking torque value measured to the standard torque of 5.6 - 6.8 N.m (50 - 60 lb.in) to get the final torque. (29) Apply the final torque to the nut (19) with a torque wrench, as follows: (a) Tighten the nut (19) to the bolt (7) to remove clearance. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 27-31-08 Page 8 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (b) Torque the nut (19) with the minimum final torque value. Continue to torque as necessary to align the slot in the nut (19) with the cotter pin (18) hole in the bolt (7). NOTE: Be careful not to apply more than the maximum final torque value. (c) Safety the nut (19) to the bolt (7) with a new cotter pin (18). (30) If necessary, connect the bonding straps (2) and (3) to the support at the spring tab (1) with the screw, three washers, and nut (12). Refer to DET. E. NOTE: Refer to (AMM TASK 20-13-21-910-801-A/200) for the correct installation of the bonding straps (2) and (3). (31) Do the bonding test (AMM TASK 20-13-21-700-801-A/200). (32) Do the bonding protection ( AMM TASK 20-13-21-910-802-A/200). (33) Install the fairing (28) ( AMM TASK 55-14-00-400-801-A/400). Refer to DET. F. (34) Install the fairing (29) ( AMM TASK 55-14-00-400-801-A/400). Refer to DET. G. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) If you replaced the spring tab by a different one do the Elevator Balancing Check ( AMM TASK 51-60-00-700-801-A/500). NOTE: It is not necessary to do the Elevator Balancing Check when you install the same spring tab in the same elevator assembly. (2) Measure the backlash of the spring tab (AMM TASK 27-31-00-700-801-A/500). NOTE: • Do not measure the servo tab and elevator backlashes. • Do this step only if you replaced the spring tab with a new one or if you replaced it with a spring tab used on other aircraft. (3) Do the operational check on the servo tabs (AMM TASK 27-31-04-700-801-A/500). (4) Do the check of the adjustment of the backstop of the spring tabs ( AMM TASK 27-31-08-700-801-A/500). NOTE: Do this step only if you replaced the spring tab with a new one or if you replaced it with a spring tab used on other aircraft. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 27-31-08 Page 9 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
